Name: Tyrolean Roulette
Description:
"Tyrolean Roulette" is a game that consists in a spinning top that hits balls randomly and hopefully the right ones hit big points and wrong ones stay out or go in small numbers.

It has small pockets with small numbers and 8 big pockets with big numbers.

Green Balls count - 2X
Natural color - 1X
Red Ball - minus points

If you can insert all 13 balls in a turn, you can play again.

Game ends when one player reach the agreed score (Ex:500points)

Name: Bus Stop
Description: The goal of Bus Stop is to be the first player to bring all of your passengers to the bus station.  Buses move around the board picking up passengers and carrying them from stop to stop, with the bus' movement determined by rolling a die.  To reach the bus station your passenger must be on the front seat of the bus as it passes the station.  If a bus reaches a terminus space, all passengers must alight.

Name: Word Shout
Description:
You roll all 10 letter dice and the goal is to shout out a word of at least 3 letters that can be made with the dice.  You cannot rearrange the dice on the table after they are rolled.  When you shout a word, you take the letter dice that make that word and put them in front of you.  Play continues until no more words can be made out of the remaining dice.  The number of dice in front of you collected from the words you made is your point score for the round.  If multiple players shout the same word at the same time, the round ends and the dice are rerolled. The first player to 50 points wins.

It comes with a plastic click case, making it good for travel.

Name: Salvo!
Description:
Salvo! is a battery-operated game for two players where the goal is to sink your opponent's ships.  After each player has set up their ships on the board, players take turns to fire at their opponent.  With the aid of a plastic rangefinder disc, players set the angle and range of their shot by turning two knobs.  This moves a lightbulb hidden beneath the board and when the 'fire' button is pressed, the bulb lights up if the shot is successful.

From the box:
"Salvo! A Powerful Game of Sea Warfare." - "A Brilliant New Idea.  You Fix the Angle,Range and Fire!  Can You Destroy the Enemy Fleet?"

Name: Electronic Family Feud
Description:
Come on down and play Americas favorite guessing game and face off against family and friends, This fast paced exciting electronic tabletop version of the hit television game show, Survey says--you're going to have a great time!

Contains - 1 game console, 1 stabilizer foot, 1 instruction manual and 2 score pads. Requires 4 "AA" batteries

The electronic unit will ask a question and each person writes down their top answers. When they finish, they advance the game and it will display the correct answers. The unit will ask if a person and got each answer right and if so, which opponent. The unit tracks the scores with the highest winning going to the final round!

Name: Urban Myth: Funsize Crime Edition
Description:
Urban Myth Funsize Crime Edition puts the record straight on criminal urban myths! The challenge of Urban Myth is to differentiate between fact and modern folklore - between what you thought you knew and what you have heard as gospel truth from a trusted friend. Vote on urban crime myths to win cards and be the first player to complete a crime scene picture puzzle, using your card backs to win!

* Collect cards to build a picture of a crime scene
    * The first player to complete their scene wins the game
    * All new crime edtion
    * The game with a twist
    * The truth is here!

Contents of Urban Myth Funsize Crime Edition:

* 100 Playing Cards
    * 6 Answer Cards
    * Players Guide

Name: Electronic Price is Right
Description:
It is so easy to play!  Just pick a card, enter the 3 digit number and a game appears on the screen! Includes 10 of the most popular games on the Price is Right TV show:
Pick a Pair, Magic Number, Cliff Hangers, Big Wheel, Plinko, Clock Game, Grocery Game, Showcase, Contestants Row, and Hi-Lo

Accurately guess the retail price of various prizes to win. Outbid opponents in 'Contestant's Row' to move on to individual challenges and the chance to win huge prizes playing your favorite games. If your pricing skills can stand the test, you'll earn a spin on the 'Big Wheel' - your chance to win even more money and earn your way to the 'Showcase Showdown'. Face off against your opponent there for your final chance to win the biggest and best prizes of all!
Families: TV Shows: The Price is Right

Name: Catch
Description:
Catch is a game from the 1970s where the objective is to catch fish.  Points are scored per poundage of fish and when all of the fish are caught, the player with the most points wins.  There are bonus points for collecting three of the same fish as well as for collecting bait cards.  The board is depicted as a flowing river and movement is governed by use of a die.  Landing on various special spaces allows players to obtain bait and enter fishing contests, along with other encounters.  A spinner is used to determine the outcome of these events.

From the box: "Catch - the fishing game for all ages"

Name: Freu' dich nicht zu früh
Description:
Don’t halloo till you’re out of the wood!

Goal. Be the first, moving all of your five meeples from 'start' to 'target' by crossing four turnable wheels.

The player's action: Move one of your meeples backwards or forwards after rolling the die with by '1 -5'; make up your mind out of three possibilities with a roll of '6': 
1. Move one of your meeples
2. Turn one of the four wheels to open/shorten your route 
   to the target
3. Turn one of the four wheels to block your opponent(s)

Your meeples are safe within weel 1 to 3, can be knocked down passing the fourth (final) wheel.

Name: Age of Honor
Description:
Age of Honor is both an expansion and scenario book for Age of Eagles I/II (Napoleonic Fire & Fury) covering the Age of Marlborough and Frederick the Great. Thus, the basic rules are needed to properly play this addition. This full color rules set contains a single page Intro - including all necessary rule changes, Unit Data Charts listing all commanders and formations that fought in this era, from the War of Spanish Succession thru the Seven Years War to the War of Bavarian Succession, a two-page Quick Reference Sheet plus Bibliography.

Scenarios contain game play specifics, a full color map, full color labels, and include:

•    War of Spanish Succession - Battles of Luzarra, Blenheim and Ramillies. 
•    Great Northern War - Battle of Poltava.
•    Austro-Turkish War - Battle of Peterwardein
•    War of Austrian Succession - Battles of Fontenoy, Hohenfriedberg and Kesselsdorf. 
•    Seven Years War - Battles of Kolin, Hastenbeck, Leuthen, Krefeld, Zorndorf, Minden, Kunersdorf and Torgau.

Age of Honor is sold direct thru digital distribution, though hardcopy versions are available from certain retailers. It is 90 pages long. Kindle formatted products are sold exclusively thru Amazon, while digital downloads exportable to PDF format may be purchased via Google Play.

Online, public research portal for this game and its historical period (to include flags for miniatures, official histories, Public Domain military maps, images and publications - all copyright friendly and FREE to download) at http://tinyurl.com/Research-Portal-Age-of-Honor.

- description provided by publisher
Families: History: War of the Austrian Succession
History: War of the Spanish Succession

Name: Tom & Jerry's Trap Game
Description: Tom & Jerry's Trap Game is a very basic game published on the back of a Kellogg's Rice Krispies cereal box.  The board is a spiral of 16 squares which leads towards a mouse trap at the centre.  Card tokens depicting Tom, Jerry, Spike (the bulldog) and the housekeeper must be played as the game progresses and the winner is the first to use up all their cards.

Name: Snap, Crackle and Pop Look at Nature
Description: "Play this Springtime Wildlife Spotting Game".  This is a simple roll-and-move game printed on the back of a Kellogg's Rice Krispies cereal box.  The game has a nature theme and involves players attempting to spot animals from the British countryside.  Players move around the board and follow the instructions printed on certain squares.  Some squares allow players to make a sighting of an animal, and the player who spots the most animals wins the game.

Name: de/le Belgotron
Description:
DE/LE BELGOTRON

Fully bilingual Dutch/French - 2 games in 1

The quiz:

Players compete in a cyclists' race, cycling from the Belgian Coast to the Belgian Ardennes. During the race, they answer trivia questions about Belgium. The first player to reach the cyclist with the yellow jersey wins. Anyone can win, whatever their knowledge about Belgium.

The political game:

Players learn to understand the inner workings of the Belgian federal State. They use their pawns to obtain strategical influence in the judicial, legislative and executive powers, and combine these powers to obtain points and make a political career from their local community to the federal government.

Name: For Love or Money
Description:
For Love or Money is based on an Australian TV game show first broadcast in 1959 on ABC.

A prize card is drawn and placed on the board (examples of prizes are fridges, drills and lawn mowers).  Along with the prize's value, each prize card also has a code on it.  The code is input into the Money Machine in the centre of the board and corresponds to a cash prize amount in shillings.  The code is input by turning two knobs on the board until the correct numbers are displayed.  A random question from the question book is read out which all players can answer,  The player to give the correct answer can choose to take either the prize card, or go for the cash prize displayed on the Money Machine.  If they select to go for the cash, a dial on the Money Machine is spun to determine the outcome.  Getting a question wrong means a player loses a life, and when all three are lost, they are out of the game.  There is also a jackpot prize to be played for.  The winner is the player with the most money and prizes at the end of the game.

From the box: "Another Chad Valley Television Game: For Love or Money - With the 'Magic Flying Shilling' Sign. ABC Television's Top Ten Quiz Game"

Name: Jimmy Savile's Pop Twenty
Description:
"Now then, now then".  This is a roll-and-move game.  The objective is to reach No. 1 in the pop charts and win the golden disc.  Pieces are moved around the board via throws of the dice.  Various squares have instructions on which move you up and down the charts.

From the box: "Here's a great new game that captures all the excitement of today's pop scene.  So join in the chart-topping race and head for the No. 1 spot with Pop Twenty!  Yours groovily, Jimmy Savile."

Name: Winter Storm: 57th Pz Korps Attempt to Relieve Stalingrad
Description:
This is an operational level game at Company/Battalion/Regiment-level simulating the battles between the Aksay and Myshkova rivers, from December 12 to December 23 in the attempt to relieve 6th Army at Stalingrad. The players control the 57th Panzer Korps or the 51st and 2nd Guards Armies. The game uses the Battle for Korsun system, which emphasizes planning and force balance. The German player must use his powerful forces to open a path close enough to the 6th Army to allow those forces to break out of the trap at Stalingrad.

The game comes in a ziplock bag with a map (four A3 sections), 225 mounted counters (not die cut), rule book and play aid charts.
